Text.Value: A grisly corpse and the Lord of Murder. The perfect match, really.
Ritual murder. Six corpses in total, carefully positioned. Artfully, even.
Each corpse placed with such precision. Much ill-spent care was taken to create this abomination.
These corpses are arranged with a certain sort of gruesome flair...
A frightful message, written in blood and garnished with corpses.
Even a devil wouldn't sink this low.
A 'tribute' to the Bhaalspawn of ages past. This is Amelyssan - and the five spawn she tricked into dying for her cause. It didn't help her, in the end.
There is nothing natural about displaying the dead like so.
Corpses - arranged with some intent.
Gods, what a mess.
A tableaux of the dead. The work of a proud killer - and a creative one.
A grotesque spectacle. What mind would take pleasure from this?
What a ghastly diorama...
Fire and death. Is this what this city is coming to - or is this always what it's been?
You were a little one, once. You had a life worth living.
Yaga-Shura, who carried the blood of Bhaal and fire giants both. It ran just as red as his brethren's.
The dead should be honoured or eaten - not left like this.
That corpse is huge. And is that a burning heart...?
It was a clean decapitation - I'll give them that.
Look here. The head has been cut cleanly from its owner.
Head hacked clean off and made to watch. A twisted vision.
Imagine if some of this artistry was applied to a canvas instead of dead bodies.
No blood - but no less vicious a display. To what end?
Rest in peace, wherever you are.
This is meant to be Balthazar - a Bhaalspawn we faced in years past. The 'artist' did not think much of him.
Dead flesh and bone rendered into a foul art form.
This corpse has been desecrated - displayed. And there's nothing random about it.
Someone's sending a message. And I'm not sure I care for it.
Even in death, these dragonborn tell a tale. I should take a closer look.
The bodies are treated as characters, not corpses. What story are they telling?
Hmm. Corpses as a statement. Someone enjoys their bloody work.
Dragonborn cadavers? No, not just cadavers, but effigies. This isn't just spectacle - it's storytelling.
Don't worry. You'll be avenged.
A re-enactment of Abazigal's death. The only dragon born of Bhaal's line, but he died the same as the rest of them.
What blood-maddened mind would concoct such a display?
This is a ritual killing. And the murderer wanted it found.
Dead drow, dead spiders - I can't imagine Lolth would approve.
Numerous corpses - but my eyes are drawn to the drow, all dressed alike.
Each figure alike in its pose, unique in its horrors.
Why arrange the dead like so? To intimidate us?
Horrifying - so many damned corpses.
Sick shit.
This is supposed to be Sendai, a Bhaalspawn who planned to make war on her brother. But we got to her first.
Unhinged corpse displays - like artwork ripped from the Hells themselves.
This body... a sacrifice, or some kind of display?
Well, someone fancies themselves an artist.
Each one of these corpses has been arranged symmetrically - and purposefully.
A murderer with artistic ambitions. Can't say I appreciate their body of work.
Hells, they're displaying murder victims openly now...
Hells. Only a broken mind could create such a sick scene as this.
My gods. This is sick.
This... stirs a memory. Some sick creature was playing out the death of Bhaalspawn, Illasera.
A foul assembly. No corpse should be subjected to this.
Someone was... arranging these corpses. What for?
